outputs.generated_input: title: Astro-Biology: Unraveling the Mysteries of Life through Astronomy and Molecular Biology. Smith, Johnson, Williams. November 2024. Astronomy, Molecular Biology. Keywords: astrobiology, extraterrestrial life, molecular biology

normalized.title: Astro-Biology: Unraveling the Mysteries of Life through Astronomy and Molecular Biology

outputs.generated_input: abstract: Abstract: This paper presents a pioneering approach to the search for extraterrestrial life, combining the observational techniques of astronomy with the analytical tools of molecular biology. By examining the spectral signatures of distant exoplanets for signs of biochemically relevant molecules, we aim to identify potential habitats for life beyond Earth. Conclusion: Our research opens up a new frontier in the search for extraterrestrial life, demonstrating the power of interdisciplinary collaboration in expanding our understanding of the universe.

By examining the spectral signatures of distant exoplanets for signs of biochemically relevant molecules, we aim to identify potential habitats for life beyond Earth. Conclusion: Our research opens up a new frontier in the search for extraterrestrial life, demonstrating the power of interdisciplinary collaboration in expanding our understanding of the universe.

By examining the spectral signatures of distant exoplanets for signs of biochemically relevant molecules, we aim to identify potential habitats for life beyond Earth.

dataset.generator_prompt:
Your task is to generate an abstract for a fictional research paper that bridges two distinct academic disciplines, combining their methodologies, theories, and insights to explore a novel research question or hypothesis.
Each abstract should clearly state the interdisciplinary fields involved, the research question or hypothesis, the methods used for investigation, key findings, potential implications of the research, and a consice conclusion.
Be imaginative in linking the disciplines and ensure the research topic is innovative and thought-provoking.
Do not return python code
Guidelines:

Start with a concise title that reflects the interdisciplinary nature of the paper.
Clearly mention the two (or more) fields being combined.
Describe the research question or hypothesis.
Outline the methodology or approach taken.
Summarize the key findings or results.
Discuss the implications or potential impact of the research.
Do not confuse the conclusion for the abstract
Do not repeat titles that have been generated, ALWAYS generate a new title every time
NEVER return a nonetype abstract, and to ensure this, you need to be very creative about how you generate paper titles such that you can always provide an abstract


{{few_shot}}


List:
dataset.normalizer_prompt:
Format the following address as a list of python dictionaries of the form:
[
    { 
        "title": str,
        "authors": str, 
        "publication_date": str,
        "fields": str,
        "abstract": str, 
        "conclusion": str,
        "keywords": str

    }
]. 

Be sure to handle multiple authors, keywords and fields correctly

Input:
"{{irp}}"

[{
